intro: Telipogon elcimeyae, commonly known as the Elcimeyae spikerush, is a rare and specialized plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and a dense cluster of spike-like flower clusters. This plant is typically found in moist, nutrient-poor habitats such as peat bogs and wet meadows. Its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination, which is common among members of its family. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Telipogon elcimeyae is considered a sensitive indicator of undisturbed wetland environments.
